articles.title: Equatorial Guinea president wins re-election, claims VP on Twitter - The Africa Report
articles.description: Equatorial Guinea’s President Teodoro Obiang Nguema has won re-election with 95% of the Nov. 20 vote and his party took all the senate and parliament seats, his son Vice President Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue said on Twitter on Saturday.
articles.content:
A win would given Obiang, 80, a sixth term in office, extending his 43-year rule and cementing his place as the worlds longest-standing ruler.
